headline.print_headline: Britain's Just Retirement Lifted by Lifetime Mortgage Sales
headline.main: Britain's Just Retirement Lifted by Lifetime Mortgage Sales

docs.lead_paragraph: Just Retirement Group reported an 11 percent rise in half-yearly underlying operating profit as higher demand for lifetime mortgages boosted the pension provider's maiden results since its 1.1 billion pound initial public offering in November.
docs.snippet: Just Retirement Group reported an 11 percent rise in half-yearly underlying operating profit as higher demand for lifetime mortgages boosted the pension provider's maiden results since its 1.1 billion pound initial public offering in November.

headline.main: Do You Pay Attention to Nutrition Labels on Food?

docs.abstract: Does knowing nutritional information help you make healthier eating choices?
docs.snippet: Does knowing nutritional information help you make healthier eating choices?

docs.abstract: Editorial cites report in The Journal of the American Medical Assn that found obesity rate in young children has dropped; holds finding is glimmer of good news in the struggle to control obesity in the United States; supports public policies that aim to curb youth obesity, like changes in nutrition labels proposed by the Food and Drug Administration.
docs.lead_paragraph: A modest step in the right direction for a small slice of the population suggests further gains may be possible.
docs.snippet: A modest step in the right direction for a small slice of the population suggests further gains may be possible.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Proposes Major Update to Food Labels in Bid to Combat Obesity
headline.main: U.S. Proposes Major Update to Food Labels in Bid to Combat Obesity

docs.lead_paragraph: Packaged foods sold in the United States would display calorie counts more prominently and include the amount of added sugar under a proposal to significantly update nutritional labels for the first time in 20 years as health officials seek to reduce obesity and combat related diseases such as diabetes.
docs.snippet: Packaged foods sold in the United States would display calorie counts more prominently and include the amount of added sugar under a proposal to significantly update nutritional labels for the first time in 20 years as health officials seek to reduce...

headline.print_headline: Child Care Centers to Follow First Lady Guidelines
headline.main: Child Care Centers to Follow First Lady Guidelines

docs.lead_paragraph: The nation's second-largest for-profit child care provider is adopting Michelle Obama's healthy eating and activity guidelines.
docs.snippet: The nation's second-largest for-profit child care provider is adopting Michelle Obama's healthy eating and activity guidelines.

headline.print_headline: New F.D.A. Nutrition Labels Would Make ‘Serving Sizes’ Reflect Actual Servings
headline.main: New F.D.A. Nutrition Labels Would Make ‘Serving Sizes’ Reflect Actual Servings

docs.abstract: Food and Drug Administration for the first time in two decades will propose major changes to nutrition labels on food packages, putting calorie counts in large type and adjusting portion sizes to reflect how much Americans actually eat.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration will propose major changes to nutrition labels on food packages, including more prominent calorie counts and the adjustment of some portion sizes.
docs.snippet: The Food and Drug Administration will propose major changes to nutrition labels on food packages, including more prominent calorie counts and the adjustment of some portion sizes.

headline.print_headline: New Bronx Bus Fare: Affordable Produce, Local and Organic
headline.main: Fresh Produce Comes to the Bronx via a Veggie Mart on Wheels

docs.abstract: Tanya Fields, leader of South Bronx nonprofit group BLK Projek, has begun filling an old school bus with locally and organically grown vegetables and fruits and delivering it to the poor and struggling in the area; bus, called South Bronx Mobile Market, brings low-cost produce a few times a week.
docs.lead_paragraph: The leader of a South Bronx nonprofit group is filling an old school bus with a cornucopia of locally and organically grown vegetables and fruit and taking it to the streets.
docs.snippet: The leader of a South Bronx nonprofit group is filling an old school bus with a cornucopia of locally and organically grown vegetables and fruit and taking it to the streets.

headline.print_headline: A Look at the Changing Obesity Landscape for Kids
headline.main: A Look at the Changing Obesity Landscape for Kids

docs.lead_paragraph: Is the anti-obesity message finally getting through?
docs.snippet: Is the anti-obesity message finally getting through?

headline.print_headline: Obesity Dropped 43% Among Young Children in Decade, Study Finds
headline.main: Obesity Rate for Young Children Plummets 43% in a Decade

docs.abstract: Federal health authorities publish report in The Journal of the American Medical Assn that finds a 43 percent drop in obesity rate among 2- to 5-year-old children over the past decade; it is the first broad decline in an epidemic that often leads to lifelong struggles with weight; trend comes as a welcome surprise to researchers.
docs.lead_paragraph: The data, reported in a major federal health survey, offered the first clear evidence that America’s children have turned a corner in the obesity epidemic, and came as a surprise to researchers.
docs.snippet: The data, reported in a major federal health survey, offered the first clear evidence that America’s children have turned a corner in the obesity epidemic, and came as a surprise to researchers.
